Recommendation.title: Diagnose and Resolve 500 Internal Server Error

steps.description: Reviewing server logs can reveal specific error messages indicating the cause of the 500 error, such as configuration issues or resource limits.
Monitoring CPU, memory, and disk usage helps identify if the server is overwhelmed, which could be causing the error.
Checking configuration files for syntax errors or incorrect directives is crucial as misconfigurations often lead to 500 errors.
Examining application logs can uncover bugs or errors in the code that might be causing the server to fail.
Ensuring all services are running and network settings are correct is essential for proper server operation.
If issues persist, stress testing and prolonged monitoring can help identify intermittent or load-related problems.
